location: A part of the Grecian camp.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Agamemnon, how if he had boils full, all over, generally

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: And those boils did run say so: did not the general run then were not that a botchy core

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Then would come some matter from him I see none now.

lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: Thou bitchwolfs son, canst thou not hear Feel, then.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: The plague of Greece upon thee, thou mongrel beefwitted lord!

lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: Speak then, thou vinewedst leaven, speak: I will beat thee into handsomeness.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: I shall sooner rail thee into wit and holiness: but, I think, thy horse will sooner con an oration than thou learn a prayer without book. Thou canst strike, canst thou a red murrain o thy jades tricks!

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Dost thou think I have no sense, thou strikest me thus

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Thou art proclaimed a fool, I think.

lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: Do not, porpentine, do not: my fingers itch.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: I would thou didst itch from head to foot and I had the scratching of thee I would make thee the loathsomest scab in Greece. When thou art forth in the incursions, thou strikest as slow as another.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Thou grumblest and railest every hour on Achilles, and thou art as full of envy at his greatness as Cerberus is at Proserpines beauty, ay, that thou barkest at him.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: He would pun thee into shivers with his fist, as a sailor breaks a biscuit.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Ay, do, do thou soddenwitted lord! thou hast no more brain than I have in mine elbows an assinego may tutor thee: thou scurvyvaliant ass! thou art here but to thrash Trojans and thou art bought and sold among those of any wit, like a barbarian slave. If thou use to beat me, I will begin at thy heel, and tell what thou art by inches, thou thing of no bowels, thou!

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Mars his idiot! do, rudeness do, camel do, do.

lines.speaker: achilles
lines.text: Why, how now, Ajax! wherefore do you thus How now, Thersites! whats the matter, man

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: You see him there, do you

lines.speaker: achilles
lines.text: So I do: whats the matter

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: But yet you look not well upon him for whosoever you take him to be, he is Ajax.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Ay, but that fool knows not himself.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Lo, lo, lo, lo, what modicums of wit he utters! his evasions have ears thus long. I have bobbed his brain more than he has beat my bones: I will buy nine sparrows for a penny, and his pia mater is not worth the nineth part of a sparrow. This lord, Achilles, Ajax, who wears his wit in his belly and his guts in his head, Ill tell you what I say of him.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: As will stop the eye of Helens needle, for whom he comes to fight.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: I would have peace and quietness, but the fool will not: he there: that he: look you there.

lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: O thou damned cur! I shall

lines.speaker: achilles
lines.text: Will you set your wit to a fools

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: No, I warrant you for a fools will shame it.

lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: I bade the vile owl go learn me the tenor of the proclamation, and he rails upon me.

lines.speaker: achilles
lines.text: Your last service was sufferance, twas not voluntary: no man is beaten voluntary: Ajax was here the voluntary, and you as under an impress.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Een so a great deal of your wit, too, lies in your sinews, or else there be liars. Hector have a great catch, if he knock out either of your brains: a were as good crack a fusty nut with no kernel.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Theres Ulysses and old Nestor, whose wit was mouldy ere your grandsires had nails on their toes, yoke you like draughtoxen and make you plough up the wars.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Yes, good sooth: to, Achilles! to, Ajax! to!

lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: I shall cut out your tongue.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: Tis no matter! I shall speak as much as thou afterwards.

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: I will hold my peace when Achilles brach bids me, shall I

lines.speaker: thersites
lines.text: I will see you hanged, like clotpoles, ere I come any more to your tents: I will keep where there is wit stirring and leave the faction of fools.

lines.speaker: achilles
lines.text: Marry, this, sir, is proclaimd through all our host: That Hector, by the fifth hour of the sun, Will with a trumpet twixt our tents and Troy Tomorrow morning call some knight to arms That hath a stomach and such a one that dare MaintainI know not what: tis trash. Farewell.

lines.speaker: achilles
lines.text: I know not: tis put to lottery otherwise He knew his man.

lines.speaker: ajax
lines.text: O, meaning you. I will go learn more of it.
